title: This is what Mr Darcy from Pride & Prejudice would have REALLY looked like
text:
This is what Mr Darcy from Pride & Prejudice would have REALLY looked like Colin Firth didn't actually look anything like literature's most infamous handsome hunk Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mr Darcy didn't look anything like what you thought Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Pride and Prejudice fans might want to look away now. 
As literature's most famous hunk, Mr. Darcy has been the fantasy of basically every woman - and likely even some men - over the years. 
The fantasy took on another life of its own when Colin Firth set pulses racing when he took on the character in 1995 TV series, Pride and Prejudice. 
But while most fans imaging him as a tall, dark and handsome kind of guy, historians have just burst that bubble once and for all. Colin made the role famous (Photo: BBC) 
A host of leading academics have researched how Mr Darcy was likely to really have looked, and you might not like the results. 
Mr Darcy was likely to have a long nose, pointed chin, and powered white hair, which is a far cry from what most people have imagined. 
Amanda Vickery, Professor of Early Modern History at Queen Mary University of London, said: "Mr Darcy is an iconic literary character, renowned for his good looks, charm and mystery. "As Austen wrote Pride and Prejudice in the 1790s, our Mr Darcy portrayal reflects the male physique and common features at the time. We prefer Colin (Photo: BBC) 
"Men sported powdered hair, had narrow jaws and muscular, defined legs were considered very attractive. 
"A stark contrast to the chiselled, dark, brooding Colin Firth portrayal we associate the character with today", which has been "sexed up" with a "turbo-charged injection of testosterone and steamy romance," she added. 
"These illustrations might lead to a slightly different imagining of one of the most famous romantic heroes of all time." Like us on Facebook
